intro: Ranunculus sardous var. pseudotrachycarpus, commonly known as the Sardonic Ranunculus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features palmate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow, white, or orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
